title: Calories in Great Northern Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in great northern beans per cup, including protein, carbs, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Cooked from dry, drained, no added salt, fat, or seasonings; 1 cup ≈177 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by preparation, brand (canned vs. home-cooked), and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked great northern beans provides ~209 kcal and ~15 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sautéed with 1 tsp olive oil per cup
In a bean salad with vinaigrette (1 tbsp per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of great northern beans?
faqs.a: About 209 kcal for 1 cup (177 g) cooked, plain.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in great northern beans?
faqs.a: One cup provides ~15 g protein, making them a great plant-based source.

faqs.q: Are great northern beans high in fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 cup has ~13 g fiber, supporting digestion and satiety.

faqs.q: Do great northern beans have fat or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Very low fat (~0.7 g per cup) and 0 mg cholesterol.

faqs.q: How do canned great northern beans compare nutritionally?
faqs.a: Similar calories but higher sodium (~400-500 mg per cup); rinse to reduce.
